Package ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager

Class DrivingAssistSwitchManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager.DrivingAssistSwitchManager

  • public class DrivingAssistSwitchManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods related to Advanced Driver Assistant System (ADAS) features.

    These features include Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC), Forward Collision Warning (FCW), Front Automatic Emergency Braking (FAEB), Door Open Warning (DOW), Traffic Sign Recognition (TSR), and Rear Collision Warning (RCW). You can use the methods in this class to check whether the features are enabled, set whether to enable the features, subscribe to or unsubscribe from state changes of the features.

    Since:
    5
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.ADAS

      • isACCSwitchOn

        public boolean isACCSwitchOn​()
                      throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether ACC is enabled.

        The ACC feature uses a sensor to detect traffic states and adjusts a vehicle's speed accordingly. When the sensor detects that a vehicle is too close to the vehicle ahead, ACC decelerates the vehicle to maintain a safe distance. When the sensor detects that the distance becomes longer, ACC accelerates the vehicle to the predefined cruise speed.

        Returns:
        Returns true if ACC is enabled; returns {code false} otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • enableACCSwitch

        public void enableACCSwitch​(boolean value)
                     throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                            java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets whether to enable ACC.
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies whether to enable ACC. The value true means to enable ACC, and false means to disable it.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • subscribeACCSwitchState

        public void subscribeACCSwitchState​(AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback callback)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                    ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to ACC state changes.

        A callback is invoked to notify the application of ACC state changes.

        Sample code: 

         
 class DrivingAssistSwitchCallback extends AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback {

     @Override
     public void onChangeBooleanSignal(boolean value) {
     }

     @Override
     public void onErrorBooleanSignal() {
     }
 }
 DrivingAssistSwitchCallback callback = new DrivingAssistSwitchCallback();
 try {
     drivingAssistSwitchManager.subscribeACCSwitchState(callback);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException | UnsupportedOperationException exception) {
     exception.printStackTrace();
 }
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to be invoked to perform a specific operation when the ACC state changes.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • unsubscribeACCSwitchState

        public void unsubscribeACCSwitchState​()
                               throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from ACC state changes.

        You can call this method if you no longer need to monitor ACC state changes.

        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • isFCWSwitchOn

        public boolean isFCWSwitchOn​()
                      throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether FCW is enabled.

        The FCW feature uses a sensor to detect and monitor the vehicles ahead. When the sensor detects that there is a vehicle ahead, FCW measures the distance between the vehicles and their speeds. If a risk of rear-end collision is determined based on a safety distance model, FCW alerts the drivers of threats ahead, in compliance with warning rules.

        Returns:
        Returns true if FCW is enabled; returns {code false} otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

                     throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                            java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • isFAEBSwitchOn

        public boolean isFAEBSwitchOn​()
                       throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                              java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether FAEB is enabled.

        The FAEB feature uses a sensor to detect a possible crash and alerts drivers to take actions. If necessary, the brakes are automatically applied to prevent collision or minimize the collision damage.

        Returns:
        Returns true if FAEB is enabled; returns {code false} otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • isDOWSwitchOn

        public boolean isDOWSwitchOn​()
                      throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether DOW is enabled.

        The DOW feature uses a sensor to detect the approaching of a vehicle from behind and provides alerts to prevent collision based on the speed of the upcoming vehicle and the distance between the vehicles.

        Returns:
        Returns true if DOW is enabled; returns {code false} otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

        public boolean isTSRSwitchOn​()
                      throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether TSR is enabled.

      • isRCWSwitchOn

        public boolean isRCWSwitchOn​()
                      throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether RCW is enabled.

        The RCW feature uses a sensor to detect a vehicle approaching from behind in real time and provides alerts to the driver in the fast-moving vehicle if there is a risk of being rear-ended.

        Returns:
        Returns true if RCW is enabled; returns {code false} otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5
